website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for outdoor brewing.
pros: Large 14-cup capacity and all the heat resistance of an enamel coating
Can deliver percolated and unfiltered "cowboy coffee" equally well
cons: not the best option for the kitchen
Some concerns about the durability and replacement of internal parts

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage. The basket will not stand straight up
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. The basket will not stand straight up, it flops against the sides, every time. This means you have to mess with the lid, to get it own. Every percolator, I have ever had, the basket stood straight up. The basket is made from aluminum, so thin, I could crush it, in my arthritic hands. Make coffee in a sock. Less hassle and less waste of money, than this junk. 1 star is too high. The stem for the basket was not even made straight. Now ,1 week later the glass on top broke off,dropping glass into the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Chille

customer_reviews.title: Had higher hopes for its durability.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but it arrived chipped around the handle and I can hear the handle creak a little bit with a little pressure even though it's welded to the pot. I imagine over time it will chip some more around the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: This pot was dangerous. The lid would not fit into the top of the pot when the basket was in the pot. As water boiled up into the pot, steam escaped from the sides and also caused coffee grounds to boil over into the coffee. In order to pour coffee, the lid and basket had to be removed first, which was very hot and dangerous to do. Otherwise, both the lid and the basket would fall out while trying to pour. I received slight steam burns but could have been worse.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: We have a lot of coffee percolators and this is the worst one I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Haven't even used this, it is not useable! The basket doesn't fit into the lid so the lid will not close properly. Even without the basket the lid does not fit tight. If I were to try to pour coffee from this the lid would fall right off! Also, the basket assembly if very flimsy aluminum and would not last long anyway. We have a lot of coffee percolators and this is the worst one I have ever had. Not happy and I am returning it for refund right away.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Miedema

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was getting just as many cups of coffee from my twelve cup percolator as this cheap imitation. The glass knob broke off about the 5th use and Coleman stocks no replacements. I'll never buy another Chinese made Coleman product again. I also complained to Coleman and they wanted me to do a kabuki dance for any adjustment. If they had been closer, I would have thrown it at them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: You don't want this.
customer_reviews.text: The internals are made of thin aluminum and were bent. The lid did not fit. The pot leaked where the handle connects at the bottom. This  is stainless steel throughout and is of much higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: abc

customer_reviews.title: Will return but have to pay
customer_reviews.text: For return shipping ugh Omg the pot itself is not too bad but the stem and basket are very flimsy and arrived deformed I think it was also mismatched
customer_reviews.author: jack davanzo

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Despite reading other reviews, I purchased this anyways. Quality is just not there unfortunately. I had to bend the basket stand to make the lid close completely. Once the lid closed, the basket did not stay upright. Tried to used it this past weekend camping and it was a disaster. After getting the water to finally start bubbling, it would not come up thru the center stand. Needless to say, I dumped it all out and used another method. Returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS COLEMAN Product.  ITS NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: What a cheap copy of a coffee pot. Coleman, SHAME SHAME SHAME on you for cheapen your name and value because of this shoddily manufactured coffee pot. The glass knob broke after the second use. The basket and perk stem is extremely light weight and bends easily and does not actually fit the pot. The porcelin has already chipped at the handle and exposed the metal underneath. I wish we had read the reviews before placing an order! If I could send it back, but the time allowed by Amazon has expired. We will just kept dealing with it for now but, I will make sure and read the reviews before purchasing a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: MrWildStarr

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This pot does not make 14 cups of coffee. We measured the cups & even if the cups only held 6 oz, it still doesn't make 14 cups of coffee. We were lucky to get 8 cups out of it. It's a small pot, plus it's much thinner than is described..
customer_reviews.author: OKdokie

customer_reviews.title: NOT A 14 CUP
customer_reviews.text: Not 14 cup more like 8 cup any more and you 'll have water coming up the sprout. I was looking for more than 8 cup for upcoming family gathering. Lid is not snug. It won't fall off but not snug and have comestic damage in several areas. Only thing it got going for it is the style. I liked the blue spackle but for the price for a 8 cup not a 14 cup I could have got one for less than 9 dollars at my local store.
customer_reviews.author: K661944

customer_reviews.title: Ok buy
customer_reviews.text: Pot itself made sturdy, will last. The inside filter/strainer & spout flimsy material thin. Though made coffee ok. Fill pot 12 cup level comes out spout. Will survive my use.
customer_reviews.author: KMAKid

customer_reviews.title: Poor percolator! Nice Pitcher.
customer_reviews.text: A really good pitcher, but the basket (percolated) is the wrong size! Not large enough at the base to perc and it is too short; the tube doesn't reach up into the bubble on the lid. Very dis-satisfied! AND, it would cost more time and trouble than its' worth to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Richard LeNoir

customer_reviews.title: I was able to make good coffee out of this percolator
customer_reviews.text: I was able to make good coffee out of this percolator. You need to buy a coarse ground so that it doesn't go through strainer. The lid doesn't sit well on mine as the entire basket sits too high and crooked there's no way to adjust. The lid has a catch but is shaky enough that you have to hold the lid on. Overall, I wouldn't have purchased if I knew. i'd send back if I , but I'm too lazy. Looking at other percolators now. I need something bigger for a group campout. I like percolator coffee. Coleman should take their name off this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We were sceptical when we purchased, as the innards seem a little chincy. However, it has only proved to work great and make a perfect batch of coffee over and over! Plus, it produces quite a large amount for when we have extras enjoying a cup of joe with us in the morning out camping in our travel trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Actionjacksonak

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it was made for some other size
customer_reviews.text: The construction of the pot itself is ok, but the inner workings (the parts that make it a coffee maker) are awful. It looks like it was made for some other size, cause it just kind of lays in there and rattles around. And it's like it's made out of aluminum foil. Look at it the wrong way and it bends and breaks. If you actually want a working percolator to take camping, skip this one. It won't last more than one trip, if it lasts one at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this percolator
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this percolator, and I would give it far more stars if the glass bubbler thing in the center didn't break on every single one. I thought I broke the first one, but we didn't do anything to the second one, it wasn't dropped, there were no severe temperature differences, one of the little tabs that keeps in the top just broke off randomly. Now I have to buy another new one.. because while there is a part number for the little glass thingie, NO ONE sells it. Not Amazon, no retail stores, I can't even order it directly from Coleman. It's more difficult to find than a new ceramic crock for a crock pot.
customer_reviews.author: C. Morris

customer_reviews.title: well..glass topper broke before use...  now what
customer_reviews.text: .. using the old lid off our previous coffee maker.. warning !!! new lid useless...
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Doreen

customer_reviews.title: Top notch pot!
customer_reviews.text: Superior capacity - makes enough coffee for four serious campsite java junkies. A real timesaver. The aluminum percolator assembly is made of a very malleable metal and is easy to bend out of shape when it's hot, so if you bend anything, you can straighten everything out if you heat up the metal by running warm water over it and bending gently back into shape - don't attempt to bend anything while the metal is cold, since it's on the thin side and could be damaged where the tube joins the percolator base. Nice pot - the lid stays on when you pour too - no scalding surprises!
customer_reviews.author: jokermtb

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I was a bit disappointed in Coleman with this percolator. There’s nothing that secures the kid to the pot, so you have to hold it while you pour or risk the lid falling off. And the coffee filter is cheap aluminum that feels like it will bend easily. The ONLY reason I am keeping it is because I cannot find any other brand that makes a 14 cup percolator.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie C.

customer_reviews.title: This coffee pot is great. We use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot is great. We use it everyday. We cook on a gas stove and we like this coffee pot for that. We bought this to replace one that we had that the stem had broken in. It wasn't as nice as this one is. This one is made of very heavy material except the stem isn't as heavy as it could be constructed. Needs more tacs in the metal where the stem and base are connected. That's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Evie

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could buy replacement parts for it
customer_reviews.text: I Love this coffee pot, except the glass piece on top broke and can not be replaced. I have been using it any way (with the glass piece balancing on top)cause other wise its is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Harper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, really was hoping to enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: The glass top, broke after only being used 5 times. We sat it on our wood burning stove to warm coffee up, and it busted and fell into the coffee. Now we can not find a replacement piece for it. Not even at the Coleman website. Disappointed, really was hoping to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and used it about four times then the basket stem broke from the bottom base. I know from the start it was flimsy and cheaply made. What I didn't know, until today, is that if you go to Coleman's online store to order a replacement, they no longer carry the replacement baskets, stem/base in stock. So, I'm stuck with a coffee maker and no way to make coffee (other than cowboy coffee and that is not an option). For the four times used, the coffee was good. Now, I guess it will become a target for my next trip to the back yard range. Time to look for another manufacturer; Coleman has lost my business.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty for Great Campfire Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after reading other reviews. I was extra careful with filter assembly and coffee grounds basket because other reviewers said it was easily bent. Used it on a roughing it camp trip over the open fire and on the griddle. Made great coffee, about 7 American cups of coffee when full. Only need to let your coffee percolate about 5-10 minutes to get a nice dark brew. Can adjust your time over fire depending on how strong you want your coffee. Heavy duty, stood up to the hot direct campfire every morning. Use a work glove or a thick hot pad to pull it safely on and off the fire or your camp stove.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Krieger

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Grounds didn’t stay in the basket even when only halfway filled. Also, the lid to the pot didn’t sit down on the actual pot, it was like the stem to the basket was too long. When trying to pour coffee out the lid constantly fell off the coffee pot, you had to hold it on to keep from coming off while pouring coffe. Will be looking for a different percolator for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.text: You have to be Hercules to get the lid off! the glass lip on the lid broke off into the coffee pot lid off to fill with water and coffee. When I finally got the lid off its a manufacture's flaw.
customer_reviews.author: conrad

customer_reviews.title: When I received this, I loved it, but then........
customer_reviews.text: But after using it exactly twice, the glass stopper broke. The little nubs holding it onto the lid cracked off. I returned it and they promptly sent me a new one. Again, was loving it, and the second time I used the replacement, the same thing happened! And the rim is also corroding after two uses! I'm sending this back and I hope no one else has my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Califlower

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed !!
customer_reviews.text: Seeing the Coleman name, I purchased without reading the reviews. I am so sorry for not taking the time to read. It arrived today. It was packaged nicely. Excited to open. So disappointed. It seems to be very light weight material. The stem is very fragile. Poor quality. I would never suggest to anyone to purchase Coleman products. I will never purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: THE GLASS WAS CRACK AND IT WAS NOT A 14 CUP POT AS STATED ON SITE, DOES NOT EVEN HOLD 12 CUPS! SO MUCH FOR COLEMAN"S REPUTATION
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: great pot should last a long time but the bulb ...
customer_reviews.text: great pot should last a long time but the bulb is a weak point first pot had the side broke from shipping second had a big chip out of the top I think it came from the factory like that but you can get a fitz-all top from amazon that does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Dearl D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Delievered in perfect condition
customer_reviews.text: We had ordered this perculator to be able to have hotter coffee. It came in perfect condition and did what we wanted it to do!! Mighty fine coffee!! It's not just for camping anymore!!
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Grisham

customer_reviews.title: Top for the 14 cup model difficult to find.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the coffee. Game changer in fact. Used to down a cup with my Mrs. just to be socialable. Now downing three mugs without thinking about it. Glass top? Everyone said it would break. But they also said they were easy to find. Cut my finger to the bone when it broke while washing it yesterday. 2+ hours of internet searching produced no results for a new top. A Coleman replacement parts site says "no longer supported". Sent it back today.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lid fit poorly on original percolator ordered. Exchanged through Amazon (which was amazingly easy). Second perculator arrived and lid fit was worse, plus inside stem and basket were bent!!! Insides are very cheaply made. Don’t buy this product if you want quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This looks great, but the medal pieces inside are very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This looks great, but the medal pieces inside are very flimsy. We got 1 or 2 uses out of it before they were bent and stopped working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: My husband was disappointed but seeming as it is still in working condition ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, but was broken. The enamel on the lid was chopped off. My husband was disappointed but seeming as it is still in working condition he still uses it.
customer_reviews.author: kcase

customer_reviews.title: Brews a big pot of coffee perfectly...every day, every time...
customer_reviews.text: Use this every day...if you have ever had percolated coffee and gotten away from it, give it a try once again. You will wonder why you ever quit using one of these...
customer_reviews.author: matt hangas

customer_reviews.title: Worked and looks nice!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have only used the pot for one two night camping trip but it did the job. I used this with my Coleman Triton camping stove. I was a little worried about the glass peculator top breaking due to other reviews, so I was sure to handle it with care. It was a cold camping trip with our scouts and I had many a Dad hanging around waiting for me to brew another pot of coffee on the cold mornings.
customer_reviews.author: AdamDH

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Broke. In less than a month. The glass broke at the seal while coffee was perculating and glass went into the coffee basket.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This coffee pot works well in my opinion this style of coffee pot makes much better coffee then a electronic black driip
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It is sad to wake up and find your coffeemaker does't work ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a percolator for some time. Mainly, as a backup to the electric coffeepot maker we now have. It is sad to wake up and find your coffeemaker does't work at all. My husband loves the taste of coffee made in a percolator more than an electric coffeemaker. This has made him very happy. It makes coffee fast and the coffee has a wonderful taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. I can't believe Coleman would sell such a thing. Coffee holder and stem does not match the size of the pot, way to small. The percolator dome will not lock down no matter where the ears are, you can lift it out any which way you twist it down. The interior parts are bent out of shape out of the box. Would not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Roger David Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great pot, garbage inside!
customer_reviews.text: The pot is stout great for boiling or making cowboy coffee with it. As for the perkcalator guts are garbage. Damn thing bent taken it out if the pot and it about folded setting it on the camp tablet. Could see it melting as soon you used it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ziemba

customer_reviews.title: Insides Cheap and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back before I even used the percolator. The coffee pot seemed fine but the guts were flimsy and cheap. I have serious doubts that the insides would last more than a few uses. Was not the quality I expect from Coleman or a USA made product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not seal well
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend as a gift we used it twice and it started leaking around the top as it boils it is not sealed tight was very disappointing to see after only being used twice it was broken.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: I was reviewing a coffee pot, not "blades"???
customer_reviews.text: I use this for coffee every morning. I did notice rust on the rim of the lid and am wondering what to use to seal the edge of the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Durance

customer_reviews.title: Not top notch!
customer_reviews.text: The insides are bent and the lid doesn't fit right. Not what I expected from Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Archer

customer_reviews.title: Only for decorations not use
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot itself is nice . The insides are garbage very cheap came bent hard to get apart very sharp edges coffee falls thru the holes before ever boiling so filters are a must. I expect to have cut fingers or bent the insides to unusable before a week is out. Big disappointment from Coleman
customer_reviews.author: tonia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pot for open flames as it has the glass bulb at the top instead of lexan that can melt. Durable, heavy duty and shocking that this pot would come with such a worthless filter basket and stem. The main issue is the stem as many note, it bends very easily. So, just take care and this pot will have you sipping some fine coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Capn Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good but may arrive damaged
customer_reviews.text: The size is great, i got it for my birthday, however the glass cap was broken and it was too late to return by the time I got to use it and notice.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Webster

customer_reviews.title: Having said all that it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I wanted. I got really tired of replacing coffee pots. This one is simple. Nothing to break. One problem. The second time I used it the bulb on top fell off and broke. I had to order a new universal bulb. It actually anchors the bulb to the lid so it can't move. One other thing. It's not a 14 cup, it's a 12 cup. Having said all that it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Treveline Carr Maddry

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee/Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this because the reviews weren't that good. but after using it I can honestly say this is a sturdy percolator and heats water quickly on our camp stove. A must have for a coffee drinker in the woods..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good because size
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good except for the glass top. It cracked in just two days. Emailed Coleman and they replaced the whole pot . So far I have used the replacement 5 Weeks with out any failure.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Aleman

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy junk
customer_reviews.text: Love the color of the coffee pot but it was flimsy and when we made coffee for the first time, the glass bulb burst. We did not have the burner on high, just medium. I contacted Amazon right away and returning it was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: Basket is junk,
customer_reviews.text: Basket is junk, does not stand properly, super lightweight ALUMINUM.. not steel. Not good! Health hazard
customer_reviews.author: TJ F.

customer_reviews.title: nice heave construction
customer_reviews.text: second one of these I purchased... nice heave construction. I just wish they would make the insides stronger the strainer bends too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Mae Cannizzaro

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this coffee pot and it looks great. But there is no spring on the filter tube and the lid will not fit onto the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Parisi

customer_reviews.title: Broken Glass Top
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered two of these now, and BOTH have gone back as the glass percolator top has been broken. Either poor packaging or poor design, either way two out of two fails. (Btw, no crushed boxes, etc) No i wont recommend it
customer_reviews.author: MarkT

customer_reviews.title: wow is this cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: The pot itself is lovely, but the insides? WOW really cheap! The lid also is very loose and feels like it's going to fall off when pouring.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Kuncytes

customer_reviews.title: This is a great coffee pot and arrived fairly quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee pot and arrived fairly quickly. I would agree with other reviews that the metal the stem and basket are made of is real flimsy so be careful when you clean it. Actually though I have never seen a sturdier basket and stem when I bought similar pots of this style. Makes great coffee on the campfire or stove.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Perks good coffee, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a really good perculator for the stovetop or campground fire. However, the inside basket parts are so poorly made of flimsy aluminum that they broke after a few months of use. They also don't fit the pot very properly. It would seem that the high quality of the outside of the perculator would be matched by inside parts, but not so. I tried to rig up something from an old Farberware perculator, but that didnt work so well. Now it goes pretty unused.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy B.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking spout
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and both leak at the pouring spout, it appears they were tact welded and not finish, coffee leak out the welds all over the counter. What a pain in the a_ _s. Very disappointing because there not cheap and the quality is pour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, good construction
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, good construction. This percolator brews a good cup of coffee. It's been awhile since I used a percolator and it worked fine. The only thing I won't do the next time I will not use the coffee filter that is made for the percolator because I think you have to brew the coffee a little longer to get a stronger cup of coffee, bet that be just in my head. :-) The Coleman 14 Cup Percolator is a great product and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Great size percolator
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for camping. Love the glass perc top and the capacity of the can. However, the lid got some rust around the bottom lip. Easily cleaned up though. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Makes excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Coleman stove top percolator; the first one is in my travel trailer. I love that one so much, that when my home coffee maker ceased to function, I replaced it with the 14-cup Coleman. This percolator makes delicious coffee. I will never go back to drip coffee again. This is a well made enamelware pot with a real glass top. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars is that the stem is really flimsy aluminum. You really have to be careful washing it as it wouldn't take much to break. Otherwise, I have only good things to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: The coffee pot is great - solidly built
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot is great - solidly built. The real glass in the lid is a welcome piece of hardware and not cheap plastic. My one complaint is the actual percolator basket and stem assembly is very fragile and all expenses were spared in making that part. Mine arrived out of the box bent in two places and even after bending back into position, the percolator assembly was very rickety. I will be replacing that piece with a better quality one as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: path

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my camp cookware
customer_reviews.text: I love this percolator, friend used his for many years while on hunting trips. This coffee pot looks like it will also stand up to the riggors of hard camping use.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: check product for leaks.
customer_reviews.text: The coffee pot is great after I had to return the first one because there was a small hole at the base of the handle. The replacement pot is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: I love this perculator.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this perculator. It is very sturdy. I will tell you that the coffee holder and stem is a little flemsy but I am extra careful with it. I love the fact that this doesn't stain and the glass top is sturdy. We had to throw the old one away because the top was plastic and it broke and then I tried to find a replacement and it didn't fit. My husband loves his coffee now.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a defect
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived when specified and was packaged well. We used the percolator and everything worked ok but when I washed it I felt a fought spot inside. I took a closer look with a light and found a patch that had no enamel on it and it had rusted. I'm asking for a replacement not a full refund because the product worked fine , it just had minor defect.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: The lid didn't fit when we took it out of the box and the rod part of the percolator was bent. I could bend it back into shape with my hand. As soon as it bumped something, it just bent again. There is no way this is usable for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda L.

customer_reviews.title: Glass ball top will break
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first use. Can’t find a good percolator. Top piece broke.
customer_reviews.author: jipper21

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! My house has extremely hard well water and ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My house has extremely hard well water and we were killing our electric coffee pots. My husband wanted a percolator and I love anything Coleman so we ordered this. Extremely easy to use and brews great strong coffee. No issues so far!
customer_reviews.author: MrsELC

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get a replacement glass bulb for this item so be careful with it
customer_reviews.author: Billy Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and strong coffee
customer_reviews.text: Every day, I use and enjoy my coffee with my percolator
customer_reviews.author: Muriel Perrier

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: We live off the grid so was looking forward to an "old fashioned" stove top Coffee pot. Upon receiving the Coffee pot we noticed how extremely difficult it was to remove the lid, then the basket insert was quite small for the size of the pot and made of very flimsy metal. Used the pot for about 6 weeks, by then we had repaired the basket assembly twice but the glass knob gave up. We returned the item to Amazon for a complete refund, thanks Amazon! This product is of very poor quality, would not even recommend it for camping, Coleman doesn't make em like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool for boiling water when in the wilds.

customer_reviews.title: coleman 14 cup percolator
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and it makes really good coffee. I only gave it a 3 star rating because the insert (basket/stem) is very flimsy and infact was bent when it arrived. I am sure that it will break sometime soon and I have already been looking for a replacement insert so that I have one when this one goes. ALso - I wish the handle of the percolator had some type of coating or insulator so that it would not get too hot. You have to pick up the handle with a pot holder. Otherwise, the percolator makes excellent coffee - much better than an electric percolator or drip coffee maker.

product_meta.title: Coleman Enamelware Percolator, 14 Cup
product_meta.description: Easily brew fresh, hot coffee on your outdoor adventures with the Coleman Enamelware Percolator, 14 Cup. It's made from double-coated enamel that resists cracks and easily wipes clean. It features a stainless steel rim that prevents chipping for long-lasting durability. The large 14-cup capacity makes it easy to brew plenty of coffee for a large group, while a convenient side handle enables smooth and comfortable pouring. A wide base keeps this pot steady and stable during use. This lightweight coffee percolator is easy to pack with your camping gear and won’t weigh down your load. The Coleman Enamelware Percolator comes complete with the base, tube, basket, and basket lid—everything you need to get a pot of coffee going on a stove, grill, or other heat source.
feature_bullets: Camping percolator quickly brews up to 14 cups of coffee on a camping stove or grill
Comes complete with wide base, tube, basket, and basket lid
Lightweight and rugged design ideal for regular outdoor use
Double-coated enamel resists cracks and is easy to clean
Stainless steel rim prevents chipping for long-lasting use
